trans-unit.source: Installing .NET Core on Linux
trans-unit.target: Installing .NET Core on Linux

trans-unit.source: By Zlatko Knezevic
trans-unit.target: By Zlatko Knezevic

trans-unit.source: These instructions will lead you through acquiring the .NET Core DNX SDK via the <linkText>.NET Version Manager (DNVM)</linkText><title></title> and running a "Hello World" demo on Linux.
trans-unit.target: These instructions will lead you through acquiring the .NET Core DNX SDK via the <linkText>.NET Version Manager (DNVM)</linkText><title></title> and running a "Hello World" demo on Linux.

trans-unit.source: .NET Core NuGet packages and the .NET Core DNX SDKs are available on the <linkText>ASP.NET 'vnext' myget feed</linkText><title></title>, which you can more easily view on <linkText>gallery</linkText><title></title> for the feed.
trans-unit.target: .NET Core NuGet packages and the .NET Core DNX SDKs are available on the <linkText>ASP.NET 'vnext' myget feed</linkText><title></title>, which you can more easily view on <linkText>gallery</linkText><title></title> for the feed.

trans-unit.source: Setting up the environment
trans-unit.target: Setting up the environment

trans-unit.source: These instructions have been written and tested on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, since that is the main Linux distribution the .NET Core team uses.
trans-unit.target: These instructions have been written and tested on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, since that is the main Linux distribution the .NET Core team uses.

trans-unit.source: These instructions may succeed on other distributions as well.
trans-unit.target: These instructions may succeed on other distributions as well.

trans-unit.source: We are always accepting new pull requests on <linkText>our GitHub repo</linkText><title></title> that address running on other Linux distributions.
trans-unit.target: We are always accepting new pull requests on <linkText>our GitHub repo</linkText><title></title> that address running on other Linux distributions.

trans-unit.source: The only requirement is that they do not break the ability to use Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.
trans-unit.target: The only requirement is that they do not break the ability to use Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.

trans-unit.source: Installing the required packages
trans-unit.target: Installing the required packages

trans-unit.source: Install the libunwind8, libssl-dev and unzip packages:
trans-unit.target: Install the libunwind8, libssl-dev and unzip packages:

trans-unit.source: You also need a latest version of Mono, which is required for DNX tooling.
trans-unit.target: You also need a latest version of Mono, which is required for DNX tooling.

trans-unit.source: This is a temporary requirement, and will not be required in the future.
trans-unit.target: This is a temporary requirement, and will not be required in the future.

trans-unit.source: Certificates
trans-unit.target: Certificates

trans-unit.source: You need to import trusted root certificates in order to restore NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: You need to import trusted root certificates in order to restore NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: You can do that with the mozroots tool.
trans-unit.target: You can do that with the mozroots tool.

trans-unit.source: Installing DNVM
trans-unit.target: Installing DNVM

trans-unit.source: You need DNVM as a starting point.
trans-unit.target: You need DNVM as a starting point.

trans-unit.source: DNVM enables you to acquire one or multiple .NET Execution Environments (DNX).
trans-unit.target: DNVM enables you to acquire one or multiple .NET Execution Environments (DNX).

trans-unit.source: DNVM is a shell script and does not require .NET.
trans-unit.target: DNVM is a shell script and does not require .NET.

trans-unit.source: You can use the below command to install it.
trans-unit.target: You can use the below command to install it.

trans-unit.source: Installing the .NET Core DNX
trans-unit.target: Installing the .NET Core DNX

trans-unit.source: You first need to acquire the Mono DNX.
trans-unit.target: You first need to acquire the Mono DNX.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't include Mono, but is needed to use the DNX tools on top of Mono.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't include Mono, but is needed to use the DNX tools on top of Mono.

trans-unit.source: In particular, the DNU command is not yet supported on .NET Core, requiring us to use Mono for this purpose (until DNU runs on .NET Core).
trans-unit.target: In particular, the DNU command is not yet supported on .NET Core, requiring us to use Mono for this purpose (until DNU runs on .NET Core).

trans-unit.source: Mono is the default DNX, so you can acquire it via dnvnm upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Mono is the default DNX, so you can acquire it via dnvnm upgrade.

trans-unit.source: Next, acquire the .NET Core DNX SDK.
trans-unit.target: Next, acquire the .NET Core DNX SDK.

trans-unit.source: You can see the currently installed DNX versions with dnvm list.
trans-unit.target: You can see the currently installed DNX versions with dnvm list.

trans-unit.source: Using a specific runtime
trans-unit.target: Using a specific runtime

trans-unit.source: You can choose which of the installed DNXs you want to use with dnvm use, specifying arguments that are similar to the ones used when installing a runtime.
trans-unit.target: You can choose which of the installed DNXs you want to use with dnvm use, specifying arguments that are similar to the ones used when installing a runtime.

trans-unit.source: See the asterisk in the listing above?
trans-unit.target: See the asterisk in the listing above?

trans-unit.source: It's purpose is to tell you which runtime is now active.
trans-unit.target: It's purpose is to tell you which runtime is now active.

trans-unit.source: "Active" here means that all of the interaction with your projects and .NET Core will use this runtime.
trans-unit.target: "Active" here means that all of the interaction with your projects and .NET Core will use this runtime.

trans-unit.source: That's it!
trans-unit.target: That's it!

trans-unit.source: You now have the .NET Core runtime installed on your machine and it is time to take it for a spin.
trans-unit.target: You now have the .NET Core runtime installed on your machine and it is time to take it for a spin.

trans-unit.source: Write your App
trans-unit.target: Write your App

trans-unit.source: his being an introduction-level document, it seems fitting to start with a "Hello World" app.
trans-unit.target: his being an introduction-level document, it seems fitting to start with a "Hello World" app.

trans-unit.source: Here's a very simple one you can copy and paste into a CS file in a directory.
trans-unit.target: Here's a very simple one you can copy and paste into a CS file in a directory.

trans-unit.source: A more ambitious example is available on the <linkText>corefxlab repo</linkText><title></title> that will print out a pretty picture based on the argument you provide at runtime.
trans-unit.target: A more ambitious example is available on the <linkText>corefxlab repo</linkText><title></title> that will print out a pretty picture based on the argument you provide at runtime.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to use this example, simply save the <linkText>C\# file</linkText><title></title> to a directory somewhere on your machine.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to use this example, simply save the <linkText>C\# file</linkText><title></title> to a directory somewhere on your machine.

trans-unit.source: The next thing you will need is a project.json file that will outline the dependencies of an app, so you can actually run it.
trans-unit.target: The next thing you will need is a project.json file that will outline the dependencies of an app, so you can actually run it.

trans-unit.source: Use the contents below, it will work for both examples above.
trans-unit.target: Use the contents below, it will work for both examples above.

trans-unit.source: Save this file in a directory next to the CS file that contains your code.
trans-unit.target: Save this file in a directory next to the CS file that contains your code.

trans-unit.source: Run your App
trans-unit.target: Run your App

trans-unit.source: You need to restore packages for your app, based on your project.json, with dnu restore.
trans-unit.target: You need to restore packages for your app, based on your project.json, with dnu restore.

trans-unit.source: You will need to run this command under the Mono DNX.
trans-unit.target: You will need to run this command under the Mono DNX.

trans-unit.source: The first command switches the active runtime to the Mono one.
trans-unit.target: The first command switches the active runtime to the Mono one.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to run your app under .NET Core.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to run your app under .NET Core.

trans-unit.source: As you can guess, however, before you do that you first need to switch to the .NET Core runtime.
trans-unit.target: As you can guess, however, before you do that you first need to switch to the .NET Core runtime.

trans-unit.source: The first command below does exactly that.
trans-unit.target: The first command below does exactly that.

trans-unit.source: Building .NET Core from source
trans-unit.target: Building .NET Core from source

trans-unit.source: .NET Core is an open source project that is hosted on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: .NET Core is an open source project that is hosted on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: This means that you can, at any given time, clone the repository and build .NET Core from source.
trans-unit.target: This means that you can, at any given time, clone the repository and build .NET Core from source.

trans-unit.source: This is a more advanced scenario that is usually used when you want to add features to the .NET runtime or the BCL or if you are a contributor to these projects.
trans-unit.target: This is a more advanced scenario that is usually used when you want to add features to the .NET runtime or the BCL or if you are a contributor to these projects.

trans-unit.source: The detailed instruction on how to build .NET Core windows can be found in the <linkText>Build CoreCLR on Linux</linkText><title></title> on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: The detailed instruction on how to build .NET Core windows can be found in the <linkText>Build CoreCLR on Linux</linkText><title></title> on GitHub.
